<cs> my lords with the leave of the house my noble and learned friend the lord chancellor will repeat at a convenient moment after a statement being made in another place on the lambeth southwark and lewisham area health authority <e> <s> this will be followed by my noble friend lady young who will repeat a statement on the warnock report <e>
<cs> my lords if i may just remind my noble friend he is addressing the house and not her majestys government <e>

<cs> my lords i understand that in view of the number of speakers on the main debate today the noble lord lord gifford has decided not to ask his unstarred question at the end of todays business <e> <s> i thought that it might be for the convenience of the house to know this now <e> <s> i know that your lordships will be grateful to the noble lord for the consideration that he has shown in this not only to your lordships but also to the servants of the house <e>

<cs> my lords i know that the noble lord lord janner has been trying to ask a question for some time but we have had about nine minutes on this question <e> <s> perhaps i might suggest that the noble lord lord janner asks his question and my noble friend answers it and then we might move on <e>

<cs> my lords it may be for the convenience of your lordships to know that dinners will be available this evening at the usual time <e> <s> it is proposed that the committee stage of the education bill will be adjourned at approximately oclock for approximately an hour in order to enable those of your lordships who are particularly tied up in the education bill to take advantage of this facility <e> <s> the report stage of the national heritage bill will be taken during this adjournment <e>
<cs> my lords it may be for the convenience of your lordships to know that dinner will be available this evening at the usual time <e>

<cs> my lords it may be for the convenience of your lordships to know that dinner will be available tonight <e> <s> it is proposed that the committee stage of the education bill be adjourned for about an hour at about oclock this evening and two northern ireland orders will be taken in the intervening time <e>

<cs> my lords we have come to the end of a very long week perhaps the longest and most tiring week in the history of the house of lords <e> <s> for that i must apologise to your lordships because i must accept the responsibility <e> <s> but it has also been a quite exceptional strain on the staff of the house and throughout this week they have looked after us not only without complaining but with constant cheerfulness and never-failing efficiency <e> <s> i should like on behalf of your lordships to express our gratitude to them <e>
